title: Lake Skadar
summary: Lake Skadar (Serbo-Croatian: Скадарско језеро, romanized: Skadarsko jezero, pronounced [skâdarskɔː jɛ̂zɛrɔ]; Albanian: Liqeni i Shkodrës, pronounced [liˈcɛni i ˈʃkɔdrəs]) – also called Lake Shkodër, Lake Shkodra or Lake Scutari – lies on the border of Albania and Montenegro, and is the largest lake in Southern Europe. It is named after the city of Shkodër in northern Albania (Albanian: Shkodër or Shkodra; Serbo-Croatian: Скадар, romanized: Skadar; Italian: Scutari). It is a karst lake.
